name: abolition
trans: n. 废除；废止

sentences.english: The abolition of slavery in Brazil and the Caribbean closely followed the pattern of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 巴西和加勒比海地区对奴隶制的废除很大程度上遵循了美国的模式。

detailed_translations.english: when a law or a system is officially ended

name: emancipator
trans: n. 释放者；解放者

sentences.english: After his son's death, Lincoln decided that one of his purposes was to be an emancipator -- to begin the process of freeing the slaves. A few months later, he wrote the Emancipation Proclamation.
sentences.chinese: 在他儿子去逝后，林肯确定他的一个目标就是要成为一名解放者----推动奴隶自由的进程，几个月后，他起草了《解放宣言》。

name: enslaved
trans: v. 奴役；使成为奴隶（enslave 的过去式和过去分词）

name: equality
trans: n. 平等；相等；[数] 等式

sentences.english: ...equality of the sexes.
sentences.chinese: …性别平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等同； 平等； 相等
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

name: secede
trans: vi. 脱离；退出 vt. 从…中脱离；割让

sentences.english: Singapore seceded from the Federation of Malaysia and became an independent sovereign state.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡脱离马来西亚联邦成为一个独立的主权国家。

detailed_translations.english: if a country or state secedes from another country, it officially stops being part of it and becomes independent

name: ancient
trans: adj. 古代的；古老的，过时的；年老的 n. 古代人；老人

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: Athens
trans: n. 雅典（希腊首都）

sentences.english: Can you tell me something about the Acropolis in Athens?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我讲一些关于雅典卫城的事吗?

sentences.english: If you’re on a cruise through the Mediterranean, you might only have one day in Athens.
sentences.chinese: 假如你在一个穿越地中海的乘船观光团上，你就大概只能在雅典呆一天。

sentences.english: The best thing for me is that I have equaled what I have done at Athens.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，最好的事情是，我取得了在雅典曾经取得过的成绩。

name: European
trans: adj. 欧洲的；欧洲人的 n. 欧洲人

sentences.english: European languages
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的语言

sentences.english: our European partners
sentences.chinese: 我们的欧洲伙伴

detailed_translations.english: relating to Europe or its people
someone from Europe

name: Greek
trans: n. (Greek) 希腊人；希腊语；（有希腊字母名称的）大学生联谊会会员 adj. (Greek) 希腊的；希腊人的，希腊语的 n. (Greek) （美）格雷克（人名）

sentences.english: Greek yoghurt
sentences.chinese: 希腊式酸奶

detailed_translations.english: relating to Greece, its people, or its language
someone from Greece

name: landmark
trans: n. [航]陆标；地标；界标；里程碑；纪念碑；地界标；划时代的事 adj. 有重大意义或影响的 n. （瑞典、挪）兰德马克（人名）

name: perspective
trans: n. 观点；远景；透视图 adj. 透视的

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: advocate
trans: v. 提倡，拥护；为……辩护 n. 拥护者；辩护者；辩护律师，出庭律师；律师；为（某团体）谋利益者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: atom
trans: n. 原子

sentences.english: carbon atoms
sentences.chinese: 碳原子

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

name: influential
trans: adj. 有影响的；有势力的 n. 有影响力的人物

sentences.english: He had influential friends.
sentences.chinese: 他有一些有影响力的朋友。

sentences.english: a highly influential art magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本极有影响力的艺术杂志

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of influence and therefore changing the way people think and behave

name: molecule
trans: n. [化学] 分子；微小颗粒，微粒

sentences.english: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；专利证；专利品 adj. 专利的；特许生产或销售的；显著的；公开的；（脉管等）开放的 v. 取得……的专利权；授予专利

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: physics
trans: n. 物理学；物理现象

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: annihilation
trans: n. 毁灭；溃败；（物理）湮灭，湮没

sentences.english: That is because Hamas is a terrorist organisation. Its founding charter claims the Holy Land exclusively for Islam and calls for the complete annihilation of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为哈马斯是一个恐怖组织，它的成立宪章中宣称加沙是伊斯兰独一无二的圣地，号召完全消灭以色列。

name: brainwash
trans: v. 对……洗脑，以宣传说服 n. 洗脑

sentences.english: They brainwash people into giving up all their money.
sentences.chinese: 他们给人们洗脑,使他们放弃他们所有的钱。

detailed_translations.english: If you brainwash someone, you force them to believe something by continually telling them that it is true, and preventing them from thinking about it properly

name: collaborate
trans: vi. 合作；勾结，通敌

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: colonization
trans: n. 殖民；殖民地化

sentences.english: What is the process of colonization?
sentences.chinese: 殖民地化的过程又是怎样？

sentences.english: They have known colonization, revolution and emigration.
sentences.chinese: 他们了解殖民、革命还有移民。

sentences.english: We also substituted “settlement” for “colonization” in the title of the book.
sentences.chinese: 本书标题中原先使用的“殖民”一词，也用“移民”代替。

name: invasion
trans: n. 入侵，侵略；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: the invasion of Normandy
sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

name: submit
trans: vt. 使服从；主张；呈递；提交 vi. 服从，顺从

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: breakthrough
trans: n. 突破；突破性进展

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: consumption
trans: n. 消费；消耗；肺痨

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: habitable
trans: adj. 可居住的；适于居住的

sentences.english: It would cost a fortune to make the place habitable.
sentences.chinese: 要想让这个地方可以住人得花一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: good enough for people to live in

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: transition
trans: n. 过渡；转变；[分子生物] 转换；变调

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: collaborator
trans: n. [劳经] 合作者；勾结者；通敌者

sentences.english: collaborators on a biography of Dickens
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯传记的合著者

detailed_translations.english: someone who works with other people or groups in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: compatible
trans: adj. 兼容的；能共处的；可并立的

sentences.english: The new software is IBM compatible (= can be used with IBM computers ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个新软件与IBM的计算机兼容。

detailed_translations.english: if two pieces of computer equipment are compatible, they can be used together, especially when they are made by different companies

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果；重要性；推论

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲；祭品；供奉 vt. 牺牲；献祭；亏本出售 vi. 献祭；奉献

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，风险；冒险的事；机会；双骰子游戏；（高尔夫球的）球场障碍；（庭院网球用语）可得分区域；（台球）落入袋中 v. 大胆猜测；冒……的危险，使遭受危险；冒昧提出 n. (Hazard) 哈泽德（人名）

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

name: navigational
trans: adj. 航行的，航运的

sentences.english: The crash was a direct result of inadequate navigational aids.
sentences.chinese: 坠机是导航不力的直接后果。

detailed_translations.english: Navigational means relating to the act of navigating a ship or an aircraft

name: obligate
trans: v. （使）负有法律（或道义）责任；以（资产）为担保；（使）感激 adj. 专性的；必需的 n. 专性有机体

sentences.english: The ruling obligates airlines to release information about their flight delays.
sentences.chinese: 这一裁决迫使航空公司公布航班晚点信息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使负义务；强使，强迫；对…施以恩惠
detailed_translations.english: to make someone have to do something, because it is the law, their duty, or the right thing to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 有责任的，有义务的；必需的

name: relocation
trans: n. 重新安置；再布置；变换布置

name: city-state
trans: n. 城邦

name: civilization
trans: n. 文明；文化

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: cuneiform
trans: adj. 楔形文字的；楔形的；楔状骨的 n. 楔形文字；楔状骨

sentences.english: The chicken scratch is cuneiform.
sentences.chinese: 鸡爪印是楔形文字。

sentences.english: She wrote hymns to the gods in cuneiform.
sentences.chinese: 她用楔形文字写下了献给神祇的颂歌。

sentences.english: A 1913 statute, still on the books, sought to thwart propaganda by forbidding the hiring of "publicity experts, " a ban that has as much to do with modern communication as cuneiform tablets.
sentences.chinese: 一项1913年颁布、至今有效的法律旨在通过禁止雇用“公关专家”来阻止宣传，这道禁令涵盖的是从现代通讯到楔形文字泥板的一切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔古代美索不达米亚人使用的〕楔形文字的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the writing used by the people of ancient Mesopotamia

name: nomadic
trans: adj. 游牧的；流浪的；游动的

sentences.english: nomadic herdsmen
sentences.chinese: 游牧民

detailed_translations.english: nomadic people are nomads

name: phonologic
trans: adj. 音韵学的；语音体系的

name: pictograph
trans: n. [语] 象形文字；古代石壁画；统计图表

sentences.english: ...a pictogram of a pine tree.
sentences.chinese: …一幅代表一棵松树的象形图画。

detailed_translations.chinese: [语] 象形文字；古代石壁画；统计图表
detailed_translations.english: A pictogram is a simple drawing that represents something. Pictograms were used as the earliest form of writing.

name: annex
trans: v. 附加；获得；并吞；占为己有（非正式） n. 附加物；附属建筑物；（文件）附录 n. (Annex) （美、法、尼、瑞、加）艾尼克斯（人名）

sentences.english: Any annex is the integral part of this contract.
sentences.chinese: 本合同一切附件均为本合同的有效组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: to take control of a country or area next to your own, especially by using force

name: despair
trans: n. 绝望；令人绝望的人或事 vi. 绝望，丧失信心

sentences.english: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.english: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you have no hope at all
to feel that there is no hope at all

name: Holocaust
trans: n. 大屠杀；毁灭

name: Jew
trans: n. 犹太人；犹太教徒；守财奴 vt. 杀价；欺骗

sentences.english: The disciple was a Jew . "What good work shall I do to be acceptable to God "?
sentences.chinese: 一个犹太人门徒问：“我应该做什么样工作才能让上帝接受?”（合上帝之意?。

sentences.english: If a Christian wrong a Jew, what should his sufferance be by Christian example? Why, revenge.
sentences.chinese: 要是一个犹太人欺侮了一个基督徒，那基督徒怎样表现他的谦逊？报仇。 妹。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose religion is Judaism, or who is a member of a group whose traditional religion is Judaism

name: Nazi
trans: n. (Nazi) 纳粹党人；极端种族主义者；专横的人，凶残的人 adj. (Nazi) 纳粹党的，纳粹主义的 n. (Nazi) （伊、美、巴）娜济（人名）

sentences.english: What percentage of the audiences is Nazi?
sentences.chinese: 观众中纳粹的百分率是多少？

sentences.english: Sometimes he whipped his prey, just as he had been whipped in the Nazi labor camp from which he escaped in 1944 before he could be sent to the gas chambers.
sentences.chinese: 有时，他也会用鞭子抽打那些纳粹分子，就像他在纳粹集中营遭受过的折磨那样。1944年他逃出了集中营，否则，有可能就会被送进毒气室杀害。

sentences.english: "By translation into another language, the Nazi slogan, which is characterized not just by its meaning but also by the German language, is fundamentally transformed, " it said.
sentences.chinese: 法院称，“这条纳粹标语不仅是以其含义而且是以德文为特征的，通过翻译变成另一种语言，它就有了根本性的改变。”

sentences.english: ...the rise of the Nazi Party.
sentences.chinese: …纳粹党的崛起。

detailed_translations.english: a member of the National Socialist Party of Adolf Hitler which controlled Germany from 1933 to 1945
You use Nazi to say that something relates to the Nazis

name: occupier
trans: n. 居住人；占有者；占用者

name: capsule
trans: n. 胶囊；蒴果；太空舱；小容器 adj. 压缩的；概要的 vt. 压缩；简述

sentences.english: a space capsule orbiting the Earth
sentences.chinese: 沿地球轨道飞行的太空舱

detailed_translations.chinese: 胶囊； 航天舱， 密封舱
detailed_translations.english: a plastic container shaped like a very small tube with medicine inside that you swallow whole

name: dock
trans: n. 码头；船坞；被告席；尾巴的骨肉部分 vt. 使靠码头；剪短 vi. 入船坞 n. （Dock）程序坞 n. （Dock）人名；(老)多；(英、法、瑞典)多克

sentences.english: The crash happened as the ferry attempted to dock on Staten Island.
sentences.chinese: 这次碰撞发生于渡船试图停靠在斯塔滕岛时。

detailed_translations.english: if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload
a place in a port where ships are loaded, unloaded, or repaired
if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload

name: hatch
trans: n. 孵化；舱口 vt. 孵；策划 vi. 孵化 n. (Hatch)人名；(西)阿奇；(英)哈奇

sentences.english: The problems do not end if crocodiles successfully hatch from the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 即使鳄鱼成功地从卵中孵化出来，这些问题也不会终止。

detailed_translations.english: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

name: lunar
trans: adj. 月亮的，月球的；阴历的；银的；微亮的 n. (Lunar)人名；(西)卢纳尔

sentences.english: studies of the lunar surface
sentences.chinese: 对月球表面的研究

sentences.english: a lunar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 月食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

name: module
trans: n. [计] 模块；组件；模数

sentences.english: Switch from one module to another.
sentences.chinese: 从一个模块转换到另一个模块。

sentences.english: In this step, you create a new module for the selector.

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: excavate
trans: vt. 挖掘；开凿 vi. 发掘；细查

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

name: fossil
trans: n. 化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人 adj. 化石的；陈腐的，守旧的

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: paleontology
trans: n. 古生物学

name: drone
trans: n. 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者 n. 无人机（非正式） vi. 嗡嗡作声；混日子 vt. 低沉地说 n. n. (Drone)人名；(法)德罗纳

sentences.english: An airplane droned overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者
detailed_translations.english: a continuous low dull sound
to make a continuous low dull sound

name: monitor
trans: n. 监视器；监听器；监控器；显示屏；班长 vt. 监控

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: navigate
trans: v. 导航；航行，驾驶；找到正确的应对方法；（在互联网上）浏览；（艰难地）走过；（尤指穿过人群）带人找路

sentences.english: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

detailed_translations.english: to sail along a river or other area of water

name: remote control
trans: n. 遥控；遥控装置

name: terrain
trans: n. [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带

sentences.english: rocky terrain
sentences.chinese: 多石的地形

detailed_translations.chinese: [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of land

name: engagement
trans: n. 婚约；约会；交战；诺言；进场（游戏术语） n. 参与度（指用户点赞、转发、评论、下载文档、观看视频、咨询等交互行为）

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

name: gig
trans: n. 旋转物；鱼叉；轻便双轮马车；现场演出；临时工作 vi. 乘轻便双轮马车；起绒；叉鱼 vt. 使…起绒；用鱼叉叉；记过处分

name: improvise
trans: vt. 即兴创作；即兴表演；临时做；临时提供 vi. 即兴创作；即兴表演；临时凑合

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: jazz
trans: n. 爵士乐，爵士舞；喧闹 vi. 奏爵士乐，跳爵士舞；游荡 vt. 奏爵士乐；使活泼 adj. 爵士乐的；喧吵的 n. (Jazz)人名；(德)雅茨

sentences.english: a jazz band
sentences.chinese: 爵士乐队

sentences.english: a jazz club
sentences.chinese: 爵士乐俱乐部

sentences.english: modern jazz
sentences.chinese: 现代爵士乐

detailed_translations.english: a type of music that has a strong beat and parts for performers to play alone

detailed_translations.chinese: 奏爵士乐，跳爵士舞；游荡

name: racism
trans: n. 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见

sentences.english: The government has promised to continue the fight against racism.
sentences.chinese: 政府已承诺继续打击种族歧视。

sentences.english: the problem of racism in schools
sentences.chinese: 学校里的种族歧视问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见
detailed_translations.english: unfair treatment of people, or violence against them, because they belong to a different race from your own

name: scat
trans: v. 走开，离开；用拟声唱法唱 n. 拟声唱法；（尤指食肉动物的）粪便；金钱鱼 int. 嘘（赶猫等的呼声）

detailed_translations.english: to go away in haste

detailed_translations.chinese: 爵士音乐中无意义的音节的演唱

name: energy
trans: n. [物] 能量；精力；活力；精神

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

name: fossil fuel
trans: [能源] 矿物燃料，[能源] 化石燃料

name: global warming
trans: 全球变暖

name: hydroelectric
trans: adj. 水力发电的；水电治疗的

sentences.english: a huge hydroelectric power station
sentences.chinese: 大型水力发电站

detailed_translations.chinese: 水力发电的；水电治疗的
detailed_translations.english: using water power to produce electricity

name: pollutant
trans: n. 污染物

sentences.english: a dumping ground for toxic pollutants
sentences.chinese: 有毒污染物堆放场

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty, and is caused by cars, factories etc

name: sediment
trans: n. 沉积；沉淀物

sentences.english: a thick layer of sediment
sentences.chinese: 一层厚厚的沉积物

detailed_translations.english: solid substances that settle at the bottom of a liquid

name: cathedral
trans: n. 大教堂

sentences.english: This Gothic cathedral has attracted visitors from all around the world .
sentences.chinese: 这座哥特式的大教堂吸引了世界各地的游客。

sentences.english: Rosie gray is the one and only person , if it had not been for her , this crystal cathedral would not be here.
sentences.chinese: 她就是那一位，唯一的一人若没有她，水晶宫大教堂不会存在，这事工永远不会展开。

detailed_translations.english: the main church of a particular area under the control of a  bishop

name: celt
trans: n. 凯尔特人

name: dynasty
trans: n. 王朝，朝代

sentences.english: The Habsburg dynasty ruled in Austria from 1278 to 1918.
sentences.chinese: 哈布斯堡王朝在1278至1918年间统治奥地利。

detailed_translations.english: a family of kings or other rulers whose parents, grandparents etc have ruled the country for many years

name: fashion
trans: n. 时尚；时装；样式；方式；时髦人物 vt. 使用；改变；做成…的形状

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: massif
trans: n. 山丘，群山；断层块

sentences.english: Tanakhat Monastery complex is located on a hill of a very picturesque massif.
sentences.chinese: 塔纳哈修道院坐落在一处风景如画的山丘上。

detailed_translations.english: a group of mountains forming one large solid shape

name: vineyard
trans: n. 葡萄园

sentences.english: The wine was bottled near the vineyard.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒在葡萄园附近被装瓶封藏。

sentences.english: What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?
sentences.chinese: 这样，葡萄园的主人，要怎样处治他们呢。

sentences.english: They kept a careful watch over the vineyard throughout the growing season.
sentences.chinese: 在整个生长季节， 他们都认真地守着葡萄园。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land where grapevines are grown in order to produce wine

name: DNA
trans: abbr. 脱氧核糖核酸（deoxyribonucleic acid）；（美国）国防部核子局（Defense Nuclear Agency）

sentences.english: At the moment, the regulation on how much human DNA can be put into an animal is vague.
sentences.chinese: 目前，有关多少人类脱氧核糖核酸可以放入一只动物身上的规定，还很模糊。

name: gene
trans: n. [遗] 基因，遗传因子

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: genetics
trans: n. 遗传学

sentences.english: Genetics is also bringing about dramatic changes in our understanding of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学也正使我们对癌症的理解发生巨大的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the study of how the qualities of living things are passed on in their genes

name: hybridization
trans: n. 杂交；配种；[化学] 杂化；杂种培殖

name: species
trans: n. [生物] 物种；种类 adj. 物种上的

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: coveted
trans: adj. 垂涎的；梦寐以求的 v. 垂涎；渴望（covet的过去分词形式）；贪图

name: fob
trans: n. 表袋；短表链及其饰物

name: Magi
trans: n. 多阵γ线照射器（Multi-Array Gamma Irradiator） n. (Magi)人名；(日)马木(姓)；(意、瑞典、英、阿拉伯)马吉

name: prosperity
trans: n. 繁荣，成功

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

name: tress
trans: n. 一绺头发；发辫；卷发；枝条 vt. 把（头发）梳理成绺 n. (Tress)人名；(英、意)特雷斯

name: arachnid
trans: n. 蛛形纲动物 adj. 蛛形纲动物的

name: burrow
trans: v. 挖地洞，挖通道；依偎；挖穿；钻入；（使）……钻到……下面；（在……里）搜寻；深入查询 n. （动物的，尤指兔子挖的）洞穴，地洞 n. (Burrow) （美）伯罗（人名）

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: molt
trans: vi. 脱毛；换毛 n. 换毛；脱皮；换毛期 vt. 脱毛；换毛 n. (Molt)人名；(德、捷)莫尔特

sentences.english: Like other penguins, it undergoes an annual molt, replacing all its feathers in a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 和其他企鹅一样，它也经历一年一次的脱毛，在几周时间里替换掉所有的羽毛。

sentences.english: He said emperor penguins can spend months at a time in the ocean, coming ashore only to molt or rest, but did not know what might have caused this particular one to become disoriented.
sentences.chinese: 他说帝企鹅可以一次性在海里带上数月，上岸只是为了脱毛换羽和休息。 但不知道是什么造成了这只特别的企鹅变得分不清楚方向。

name: paralyze
trans: vt. 使麻痹；使瘫痪

sentences.english: You can bet that would truly paralyze the flow of credit: Does anyone believe Washington can manage banks?
sentences.chinese: 你可以打赌，这会使流动的信贷真正限于瘫痪：真有人相信华盛顿可以经营银行吗？

sentences.english: I think we would all agree that it is well worth it, yet many of us still choose to let this innate fear paralyze us and settle into comfortable, secure positions despite being unhappy in them.
sentences.chinese: 我想每个人都认同这些东西是值得的，但是我们中许多人尽管对目前处境不甚满意，仍然选择麻痹于内在的恐惧，停滞于安逸，保险的职位。

name: regenerate
trans: vt. 使再生；革新 vi. 再生；革新 adj. 再生的；革新的

sentences.english: Small nodules form as the liver cells regenerate.
sentences.chinese: 肝细胞再生时会形成一些小结节。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新生， 再生， 起革新作用
detailed_translations.english: to grow again, or make something grow again
to grow again, or make something grow again

name: venom
trans: n. 毒液；恶意 vt. 使有毒；放毒

sentences.english: There was real venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

sentences.english: a look of pure venom
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的表情

detailed_translations.english: great anger or hatred

name: firestorm
trans: n. 风暴性大火，大爆发

name: gasworks
trans: n. 煤气厂（等于gashouse）

name: refugee
trans: n. 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者

sentences.english: Refugees were streaming across the border.
sentences.chinese: 难民正涌过边境。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["refugee camps"]}
sentences.chinese: 难民营

detailed_translations.chinese: 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons

name: cunning
trans: adj. 狡猾的；巧妙的；可爱的 n. 狡猾

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: immortal
trans: adj. 不朽的；神仙的；长生的 n. 神仙；不朽人物

sentences.english: Plato believed that the soul is immortal.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图认为灵魂不灭。

sentences.english: ...the players considered to be the immortals of the game.
sentences.chinese: …被认为是该运动项目不朽人物的运动员们。

detailed_translations.english: living or continuing for ever
An immortal is someone who will be remembered for a long time

name: mischief
trans: n. 恶作剧；伤害；顽皮；不和

sentences.english: Now run along, and don’t get into mischief .
sentences.chinese: 好了，走开，不要捣乱。

sentences.english: They’ve got enough toys to keep them out of mischief for a while.
sentences.chinese: 他们有足够的玩具玩，暂时不会捣蛋。

sentences.english: If you can’t see Nick, you can be sure he’s up to some mischief (= behaving badly and causing trouble or damage ) .
sentences.chinese: 要是看不到尼克，就可以肯定他又在捣什么鬼了。

detailed_translations.english: bad behaviour, especially by children, that causes trouble or damage, but no serious harm

name: myth
trans: n. 神话；虚构的人，虚构的事

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: Polynesian
trans: adj. 波利尼西亚的；波利尼西亚人的 n. 波利尼西亚人

sentences.english: Allegiance to chiefs was a fundamental of Polynesian culture.
sentences.chinese: 效忠首领是波利尼西亚人最基本的文化。

sentences.english: It is possible that Polynesian rats, arriving with human settlers, may have eaten enough seeds to help to decimate the trees.
sentences.chinese: 有可能是与人类共同达到该岛的波利尼西亚鼠类，吃掉了大量的种子促成了棕榈树的大批死亡。

sentences.english: Polynesian society blossomed in this unlikely locale after hardy souls somehow navigated a fleet of wooden outrigger canoes to this tiny speck in the vastness of the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 在一群勇敢的人们驾驶着一队独木舟来到广阔的太平洋上的这个小岛上，一个波利尼西亚社会开始在这个不可思议的位置繁荣了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 波利尼西亚人, 波利尼西亚语
detailed_translations.english: a member of the people that inhabit Polynesia, generally of Caucasoid features with light skin and wavy hair

name: trickster
trans: n. 骗子；魔术师

name: apartheid
trans: n. 种族隔离

sentences.english: He praised her role in the struggle against apartheid.
sentences.chinese: 他赞扬了她在反对种族隔离制的斗争中所起的作用。

detailed_translations.english: Apartheid was a political system in South Africa in which people were divided into racial groups and kept apart by law

name: mediation
trans: n. 调解；仲裁；调停

sentences.english: Even if a marriage is doomed, the trend in family law is to resolve the dispute out of court, typically through mediation.
sentences.chinese: 即使是一桩婚姻注定要遭受失败，在家庭法中也将是趋向于在法庭外解决争执，典型的是通过调解。

sentences.english: Only solve those existing problems, the people's mediation can play better efficiency and cost advantages, and prevent and dissolve the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 解决好这几方面存在的问题才能更好发挥人民调解的效率与成本优势及预防、化解纠纷的能力。

sentences.english: It has been wisely negotiating with Syria via Turkey, and engaging Hamas on a truce deal through the mediation of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 它明智地透过土耳其与叙利亚谈判，并通过埃及的仲裁与哈马斯达成停战协议。

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议，反对；（多来自公证人）拒付证书 v. 抗议，反对；坚决表示，断言；拒付

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
sentences.chinese: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

detailed_translations.english: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something
something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

name: segregated
trans: adj. 被隔离的 v. 隔离（segregate的过去式）；分离

name: threatened
trans: adj. 受到威胁的 v. 威胁（threaten的过去分词）

name: fertilize
trans: vt. 使受精；使肥沃

sentences.english: The faeces contain nitrogen which fertilizes the soil.
sentences.chinese: 排泄物含有肥沃土壤的氮。

detailed_translations.english: To fertilize land means to improve its quality in order to make plants grow well on it, by spreading solid animal waste or a chemical mixture on it

name: genetic
trans: adj. 遗传的；基因的；起源的

sentences.english: genetic defects
sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

detailed_translations.english: relating to genes or genetics

name: hybrid
trans: n. 杂种，混血儿；混合物 adj. 混合的；杂种的

sentences.english: hybrid architecture
sentences.chinese: 具有混合风格的建筑

sentences.english: ...the hybrid corn seed.
sentences.chinese: …杂交玉米种子。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced from parents of different breeds or types
Hybrid is also an adjective

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现 vi. 复制；繁殖

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: assassinate
trans: vt. 暗杀；行刺

sentences.english: a plot to assassinate the President
sentences.chinese: 刺杀总统的阴谋

detailed_translations.english: to murder an important person

name: conspirator
trans: n. 阴谋者；反叛者；同谋者

name: dictator
trans: n. 独裁者；命令者

sentences.english: the downfall of the hated dictator
sentences.chinese: 遭人痛恨的独裁者的垮台

detailed_translations.english: a ruler who has complete power over a country, especially one whose power has been gained by force

name: ides
trans: n. 古罗马历中3、5、7、10月的第15日或者其余各月份的第13日 n. (Ides)人名；(罗)伊德斯；(俄)伊杰斯

name: omen
trans: n. 预兆；征兆 vt. 预示；有…的前兆；预告

sentences.english: The car won’t start. Do you think it’s an omen?
sentences.chinese: 汽车发动不起来。你觉得这是某种预兆吗？

detailed_translations.english: a sign of what will happen in the future

name: tyranny
trans: n. 暴政；专横；严酷；残暴的行为（需用复数）

sentences.english: Gorky was often the victim of his grandfather’s tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 高尔基经常是他祖父专横管制的受害者。

sentences.english: the fight against tyranny
sentences.chinese: 反对专制的斗争

detailed_translations.chinese: 暴政；专横；严酷；残暴的行为（需用复数）
detailed_translations.english: cruel or unfair control over other people

name: advancement
trans: n. 前进，进步；提升

sentences.english: career advancement
sentences.chinese: 职业发展

sentences.english: advancements in science
sentences.chinese: 科学进步

detailed_translations.english: progress or development in your job, level of knowledge etc

name: efficient
trans: adj. 有效率的；有能力的；生效的

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: industrialization
trans: n. 工业化

sentences.english: Lead in the quality related industrialization process and assure product and process quality / quantity of supplied parts.
sentences.chinese: 领导的质量相关的工业化进程，确保供应商零部件产品和流程的质量/数量。

sentences.english: The basic goal of the reformists is the same: to realize the industrialization of economy and the democratization of politics.
sentences.chinese: 从整体上看，改良思想家的基本目标是一致的，即：实现经济工业化和政治民主化。

sentences.english: Urbanization, although seeming to be an irreversible result of population growth, is caused by both gentrification and industrialization in fact.
sentences.chinese: 城市化现象，虽然看起来是人口增长的必然结果，事实上是由士绅化与工业化所造成的。 。

detailed_translations.english: when a country or place develops a lot of industry

name: revolutionize
trans: v. 发动革命，推翻原有政府；从事革命；彻底改革，彻底改变；灌输革命信念

sentences.english: New technology is going to revolutionize everything we do.
sentences.chinese: 新科技将彻底改变我们做的每一件事。

sentences.english: His work revolutionized the treatment of this disease.
sentences.chinese: 他的研究成果给这种疾病的治疗带来了革命。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the way people do something or think about something

name: toil
trans: v. 苦干，辛勤劳动；艰难地行走；（使）过度劳累；费力地做 n. 苦工；劳累；难事；网

sentences.english: a life of toil
sentences.chinese: 辛劳的一生

sentences.english: People who toiled in dim, dank factories were too exhausted to enjoy their family life.
sentences.chinese: 在阴暗潮湿的工厂里苦作的人们精疲力竭了，无法享受家庭生活。

sentences.english: Workers toiled long hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人们长时间辛苦工作。

detailed_translations.english: hard unpleasant work done over a long period
When people toil, they work very hard doing unpleasant or tiring tasks

name: assertive
trans: adj. 肯定的；独断的；坚定而自信的

sentences.english: Women have become more assertive in the past decade.
sentences.chinese: 妇女在过去十年已变得更坚定自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肯定的；独断的；坚定而自信的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a confident way, so that people notice you

name: circumstance
trans: n. 环境；状况；境遇；（尤指）经济状况；命运 vt. 处于某种情况

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

name: impression
trans: n. 印象；效果，影响；压痕，印记；感想；曝光（衡量广告被显示的次数。打开一个带有该广告的网页，则该广告的impression 次数增加一次）

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: interact
trans: vt. 互相影响；互相作用 vi. 互相影响；互相作用 n. 幕间剧；幕间休息

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: solitude
trans: n. 孤独；隐居；荒僻的地方

sentences.english: the solitude of her house on the lake
sentences.chinese: 她湖边那所房子的清静

detailed_translations.english: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

name: trait
trans: n. 特性，特点；品质；少许 n. (Trait) （美、法）特雷（人名）

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: calculation
trans: n. 计算；估计；计算的结果；深思熟虑

sentences.english: Cathy did a rough calculation.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

name: lecture
trans: n. 演讲；讲稿；教训 vt. 演讲；训诫 vi. 讲课；讲演

sentences.english: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
sentences.chinese: 他经常讲授法国现代文学课程。

sentences.english: He lectures on European art at Manchester University.
sentences.chinese: 他在曼彻斯特大学讲授欧洲艺术。

detailed_translations.english: a long talk on a particular subject that someone gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university
to talk to a group of people on a particular subject, especially to students in a university

name: momentum
trans: n. 势头；[物] 动量；动力；冲力

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

name: ponder
trans: vt. 仔细考虑；衡量 vi. 考虑；沉思 n. (Ponder)人名；(英)庞德

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

name: agility
trans: n. 敏捷；灵活；机敏

sentences.english: If for some reason you don't have or cannot adopt these values, then you should not worry about agility.
sentences.chinese: 如果因为某些原因您没有或者不能采用这些价值，那么您就不需要为敏捷而操心了。

sentences.english: The boy came upstairs with agility .
sentences.chinese: 那男孩敏捷地走上楼来。

name: cradle
trans: n. 摇篮；发源地；发祥地；支船架 vt. 抚育；把...搁在支架上；把...放在摇篮内

sentences.english: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
sentences.chinese: 她摇动摇篮，让宝宝安静下来。

sentences.english: Athens is often regarded as the cradle of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 雅典常常被认为是民主的发源地。

detailed_translations.english: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side

name: induct
trans: vt. 引导；感应；使…就职；征召入伍

sentences.english: The government shoulders ethic obligation, she has to induct and maintain the rationalization of the living world.
sentences.chinese: 政府在生活世界中引导和维护生活世界的合理化，肩负著伦理责任；

name: mainstream
trans: n. 主流

sentences.english: Genet started as a rebel, but soon became part of the literary mainstream.
sentences.chinese: 热内起初很叛逆，但不久就回归了文学主流。

detailed_translations.english: the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods

name: maneuver
trans: n. [军] 机动；演习；策略；调遣 vi. [军] 机动；演习；调遣；用计谋 vt. [军] 机动；演习；用计；调遣

sentences.english: The chopper shot upward in a manoeuver matched by the other pilot.
sentences.chinese: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.english: The president has tried to manoeuver the campaign away from himself.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

detailed_translations.english: a skilful or careful movement that you make, for example in order to avoid something or go through a narrow space
to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy

name: zoning
trans: n. （美）分区制；都市的区域划分

name: ancestral
trans: adj. 祖先的；祖传的

sentences.english: ...the family's ancestral home in southern Germany.
sentences.chinese: …这一家在德国南部的祖宅。

detailed_translations.english: You use ancestral to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land that they have had for a long time

name: merchant
trans: n. 商人，批发商；店主 adj. 商业的，商人的 n. (Merchant)人名；(英)麦钱特

sentences.english: the son of a wealthy merchant
sentences.chinese: 一名富商的儿子

sentences.english: There's been a big reduction in the size of the merchant fleet in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来商船队的数量大为缩减。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells goods in large quantities
Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade

name: sacred
trans: adj. 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: spiritual
trans: adj. 精神的，心灵的；宗教的；（人）高尚的 n. 圣歌（尤指美国南部黑人的）

sentences.english: Painting helps fill a spiritual need for beauty.
sentences.chinese: 绘画可以满足对美的精神需求。

sentences.english: spiritual values
sentences.chinese: 精神价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的， 心灵的； 宗教的
detailed_translations.english: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind

name: tipi
trans: n. 美国印第安人的圆锥形帐篷 n. (Tipi)人名；(土、意)蒂皮

name: align
trans: vt. 使结盟；使成一行；匹配 vi. 排列；排成一行

sentences.english: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
sentences.chinese: 书桌一行行排得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: Make sure that all the holes align.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有的洞眼成一条直线。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc

name: constellation
trans: n. [天] 星座；星群；荟萃；兴奋丛

sentences.english: a star in the constellation of Orion
sentences.chinese: 猎户座的一颗恒星

detailed_translations.chinese: [天] 星座；星群；荟萃；兴奋丛
detailed_translations.english: a group of stars that forms a particular pattern and has a name

name: impenetrable
trans: adj. 不能通过的；顽固的；费解的；不接纳的

sentences.english: The trees formed a dark and impenetrable barrier.
sentences.chinese: 这些树形成了一道无法通过的黑暗屏障。

sentences.english: the impenetrable blackness of the night
sentences.chinese: 夜晚伸手不见五指的黑

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能穿过的, 不可理喻的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to get through, see through, or get into

name: resigned
trans: adj. 顺从的；已辞职的；己放弃的 v. 辞职；顺从（resign的过去分词）

sentences.english: ‘We’ll have to leave,’ she said with a resigned sigh.
sentences.chinese: “我们不得不走啊。”她无奈地叹息道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 顺从的；已辞职的；己放弃的
detailed_translations.english: a resigned look, voice etc shows that you are making yourself accept something that you do not like

name: respective
trans: adj. 分别的，各自的

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: asperity
trans: n. （表面的）粗糙；（气候等的）严酷；艰苦的条件；（性格）粗暴

sentences.english: "I told you Preskel had no idea," remarked Kemp with some asperity.
sentences.chinese: "我跟你说过普瑞克一无所知"，坎普有点儿不耐烦地说。

detailed_translations.chinese: （表面的）粗糙；（气候等的）严酷；艰苦的条件；（性格）粗暴
detailed_translations.english: if you speak with asperity, you say something in a way that is rough or severe, showing that you are feeling impatient

name: disgrace
trans: n. 耻辱；丢脸的人或事；失宠 vt. 使……失宠；给……丢脸；使……蒙受耻辱；贬黜

sentences.english: Smith faced total public disgrace after the incident.
sentences.chinese: 事情发生之后，史密斯声名狼藉。

sentences.english: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为让家人蒙羞。

sentences.english: How could you disgrace us all like that?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能这样丢我们大家的脸呢？

detailed_translations.english: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of
to do something so bad that you make other people feel ashamed

name: forbidden
trans: v. 禁止；妨碍；不准（某人）做某事；禁止……进入；阻止（forbid 的过去分词） adj. 不被允许的，被禁止的；禁戒的；（场所）禁止入内的；禁止讨论的，忌讳的

sentences.english: Sex was always a forbidden topic.
sentences.chinese: 性在过去一直是个禁忌话题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被禁止的；严禁的，禁用的
detailed_translations.english: not allowed, especially because of an official rule

name: obstinacy
trans: n. 固执，顽固；（病痛等的）难治，难解除

detailed_translations.chinese: 固执， 倔强， 顽固

name: tapestry
trans: n. 织锦；挂毯；绣帷 vt. 用挂毯装饰

sentences.english: a colourful tapestry depicting a hunting scene
sentences.chinese: 描绘狩猎场面的彩色壁毯

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of heavy cloth on which coloured threads are woven to produce a picture, pattern etc

name: conquer
trans: vt. 战胜，征服；攻克，攻取 vi. 胜利；得胜

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: geography
trans: n. 地理；地形

sentences.english: a geography lesson
sentences.chinese: 地理课

detailed_translations.english: the study of the countries, oceans, rivers, mountains, cities etc of the world

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: landform
trans: n. [地理] 地形

sentences.english: This small country has an amazing variety of landforms.
sentences.chinese: 这个小国家拥有令人惊叹的丰富的地貌类型。

sentences.english: ...glacial land forms.
sentences.chinese: ...冰川地貌。

detailed_translations.english: A landform is any natural feature of the Earth's surface, such as a hill, a lake, or a beach

name: republic
trans: n. 共和国；共和政体

sentences.english: the former Federal Republic of Germany
sentences.chinese: 前德意志联邦共和国

sentences.english: Nine republics took part in the referendum.
sentences.chinese: 有九个共和国参加了全民公决。

detailed_translations.english: a country governed by elected representatives of the people, and led by a president, not a king or queen

name: alias
trans: adv. （罪犯或演员等）别名，化名；又称，也叫做 n. （尤指罪犯所用的）化名；（文件、互联网地址等用的）别名；错误识别 n. (Alias) （马、美、英、印）阿利亚（人名）

sentences.english: a spy operating under the alias Barsad
sentences.chinese: 一个化名巴萨德进行活动的间谍

detailed_translations.english: a false name, usually used by a criminal

name: bunker
trans: n. 沙坑；煤仓；燃料库 vt. 使陷入困境；把球击入沙坑 n. (Bunker)人名；(英、西)邦克

sentences.english: He put his second shot in a bunker to the left of the green.
sentences.chinese: 他把第二杆球打进了草地左边的沙坑。

detailed_translations.english: a large hole on a golf course filled with sand

detailed_translations.chinese: 使陷入困境；把球击入沙坑
detailed_translations.english: to hit a golf ball into a bunker

name: clandestine
trans: adj. 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的

sentences.english: a clandestine affair
sentences.chinese: 秘密关系

sentences.english: clandestine meetings
sentences.chinese: 秘密会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的
detailed_translations.english: done or kept secret

name: fabricate
trans: vt. 制造；伪造；装配

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

name: liberate

sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

sentences.chinese: 过度拥挤和卫生状况差是监狱里的普遍问题。

sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

trans: n. [病毒] 病毒；恶毒；毒害 n. (Virus)人名；(西)比鲁斯

sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

trans: n. 相互作用，相互影响；交流；[数] 交互作用；互动

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只能在实现所有方法的情况下获得最大收益，因为它们的力量来自它们之间的交互。

sentences.chinese: 但您只有在实现所有方法的情况下才能获得最多的收益，因为它们的力量来自于它们之间的相互作用。

sentences.chinese: 这个概念的很正力量并不来自于这些设备的任何一个；它来自于这些设备之间的交互。

sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.chinese: 这真的是怪兽，有点像啮齿动物，但长着恐龙一样的嘴巴。

sentences.chinese: 但是，这项新的研究发现，70%的啮齿动物和灵长目动物的物种具有阑尾。

sentences.english: Like Plasmodium, which cycles between mosquitoes and man, Toxoplasma cycles between its rodent and feline hosts, living out different phases of its existence in each.
sentences.chinese: 像疟原虫在蚊子和人之间循环一样，弓形虫的循环界于其啮齿类和猫科宿主之间，在不同宿主体内活出不同的生存阶段。

sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

sentences.chinese: 历史学家认为，埃及人的象形文字，在这此后不就也独立的发展了起来。

sentences.chinese: 想到别人在我背后说闲话让我很恼火。

sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织

sentences.chinese: 转基因的大豆和棉花不需要那么多除草剂来控制杂草，这些品种现在占美国大豆和棉花种植面积的70%以上。

sentences.english: Virtually all commercial GMOs are bred to withstand direct application of herbicide and/or to produce an insecticide.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，所有的商业性的转基因生物都可以抵抗直接作用的除草剂和/或者制造一种杀虫剂。

sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

sentences.english: They sprinkled pesticide to bug the potatoes .
sentences.chinese: 他们喷撒杀虫剂给马铃薯除虫。

sentences.english: This resulted in the contamination of the bags used in that facility's fluid bed dryers with pesticide contamination.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了由于工厂的流体床干燥器被杀虫剂污染而把使用的包装袋污染。

sentences.english: Agassi believed he had served an ace at 5-3 (40-30) in the deciding set.
sentences.chinese: 阿加西认为他在决胜盘中5-3(40-30)时曾发出过一记Ace球。

sentences.english: ...ace horror-film producer Lawrence Woolsey.
sentences.chinese: …一流的恐怖片制片人劳伦斯·伍希。

Ace is also an adjective

name: aviator

sentences.english: In fact, the history of aviator jackets can be traced back to the First World War.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，飞行员夹克的历史可以追溯到第一次世界大战时期。

sentences.english: Other hats are inspired by history and fashion, such as the iconic aviator helmet or the cabbie cap which resembles old fashioned "newsboy" hats.
sentences.chinese: 其他一些帽子则是受了历史或时尚的启发，比如标志性的飞行员头盔，或是与旧风尚‘报童帽’相似的司机帽。
